content.raw_markdown:
[](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate futures_testCopy item path
[Settings](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/settings.html)
[Help](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/help.html)
Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/src/futures_test/lib.rs.html#1-81)
Expand description
Utilities to make testing [`Future`s](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/core/future/future/trait.Future.html "trait core::future::future::Future") easier
## Modules[§](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/#modules)

[future](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/future/index.html "mod futures_test::future")
    Additional combinators for testing futures.

[io](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/io/index.html "mod futures_test::io")
    Additional combinators for testing async IO.

[sink](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/sink/index.html "mod futures_test::sink")
    Additional combinators for testing sinks.

[stream](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/stream/index.html "mod futures_test::stream")
    Additional combinators for testing streams.

[task](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/task/index.html "mod futures_test::task")
    Task related testing utilities.
## Macros[§](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/#macros)

[assert_stream_done](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/macro.assert_stream_done.html "macro futures_test::assert_stream_done")
    Assert that the next poll to the provided stream will return an empty [`Poll::Ready`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/core/task/poll/enum.Poll.html#variant.Ready "variant core::task::poll::Poll::Ready") signalling the completion of the stream.

[assert_stream_next](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/macro.assert_stream_next.html "macro futures_test::assert_stream_next")
    Assert that the next poll to the provided stream will return [`Poll::Ready`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/core/task/poll/enum.Poll.html#variant.Ready "variant core::task::poll::Poll::Ready") with the provided item.

[assert_stream_pending](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/macro.assert_stream_pending.html "macro futures_test::assert_stream_pending")
    Assert that the next poll to the provided stream will return [`Poll::Pending`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/core/task/poll/enum.Poll.html#variant.Pending "variant core::task::poll::Poll::Pending").
## Attribute Macros[§](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/#attributes)

[test](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/attr.test.html "attr futures_test::test")
    Enables an `async` test function. The generated future will be run to completion with [`futures_executor::block_on`](https://docs.rs/futures-executor/0.3.31/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/futures_executor/local_pool/fn.block_on.html "fn futures_executor::local_pool::block_on").

Settings⟨1⟩
Help⟨2⟩
SummarySource⟨3⟩
Expand description
Utilities to make testing `Future`s⟨4⟩ easier
## Modules§⟨5⟩

future⟨6⟩
    Additional combinators for testing futures.

io⟨7⟩
    Additional combinators for testing async IO.

sink⟨8⟩
    Additional combinators for testing sinks.

stream⟨9⟩
    Additional combinators for testing streams.

task⟨10⟩
    Task related testing utilities.
## Macros§⟨11⟩

assert_stream_done⟨12⟩
    Assert that the next poll to the provided stream will return an empty `Poll::Ready`⟨13⟩ signalling the completion of the stream.

assert_stream_next⟨14⟩
    Assert that the next poll to the provided stream will return `Poll::Ready`⟨13⟩ with the provided item.

assert_stream_pending⟨15⟩
    Assert that the next poll to the provided stream will return `Poll::Pending`⟨16⟩.
## Attribute Macros§⟨17⟩

test⟨18⟩
    Enables an `async` test function. The generated future will be run to completion with `futures_executor::block_on`⟨19⟩.

Utilities to make testing [``Future``s](https://docs.rs/futures-test/0.3.31/futures_core::future::Future) easier
# futures-test
Common utilities for testing components built off futures-rs.
## Usage
Add this to your ``Cargo.toml``:
```
```[``dependencies``]`
`futures-test ``=` ``"`0.3`"``
``
```

The current ``futures-test`` requires Rust 1.56 or later.
## License
Licensed under either of [Apache License, Version 2.0](https://github.com/rust-lang/futures-rs/blob/HEAD/LICENSE-APACHE) or [MIT license](https://github.com/rust-lang/futures-rs/blob/HEAD/LICENSE-MIT) at your option.
Unless you explicitly state otherwise, any contribution intentionally submitted for inclusion in the work by you, as defined in the Apache-2.0 license, shall be dual licensed as above, without any additional terms or conditions.
#### Dependencies
~265–760KB  ~16K SLoC
  * [futures-core](https://lib.rs/crates/futures-core "0.3.31")
  * [futures-executor](https://lib.rs/crates/futures-executor "0.3.31")
  * [futures-io](https://lib.rs/crates/futures-io "0.3.31")
  * [futures-macro](https://lib.rs/crates/futures-macro "=0.3.31")
  * [futures-sink](https://lib.rs/crates/futures-sink "0.3.31")
  * [futures-task](https://lib.rs/crates/futures-task "0.3.31")
  * [futures-util](https://lib.rs/crates/futures-util "0.3.31")
  * [pin-project](https://lib.rs/crates/pin-project "1.0.11")


#### [Other feature](https://lib.rs/crates/futures-test/features)
  * [std](https://lib.rs/crates/futures-test/features#feature-std)

[Settings](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/settings.html)
[Help](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/help.html)
Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/src/futures_test/lib.rs.html#1-81)
Expand description
Utilities to make testing [`Future`s](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/core/future/future/trait.Future.html "trait core::future::future::Future") easier
## Modules[§](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/#modules)

[future](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/future/index.html "mod futures_test::future")
    Additional combinators for testing futures.

[io](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/io/index.html "mod futures_test::io")
    Additional combinators for testing async IO.

[sink](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/sink/index.html "mod futures_test::sink")
    Additional combinators for testing sinks.

[stream](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/stream/index.html "mod futures_test::stream")
    Additional combinators for testing streams.

[task](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/task/index.html "mod futures_test::task")
    Task related testing utilities.
## Macros[§](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/#macros)

[assert_stream_done](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/macro.assert_stream_done.html "macro futures_test::assert_stream_done")
    Assert that the next poll to the provided stream will return an empty [`Poll::Ready`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/core/task/poll/enum.Poll.html#variant.Ready "variant core::task::poll::Poll::Ready") signalling the completion of the stream.

[assert_stream_next](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/macro.assert_stream_next.html "macro futures_test::assert_stream_next")
    Assert that the next poll to the provided stream will return [`Poll::Ready`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/core/task/poll/enum.Poll.html#variant.Ready "variant core::task::poll::Poll::Ready") with the provided item.

[assert_stream_pending](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/macro.assert_stream_pending.html "macro futures_test::assert_stream_pending")
    Assert that the next poll to the provided stream will return [`Poll::Pending`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/core/task/poll/enum.Poll.html#variant.Pending "variant core::task::poll::Poll::Pending").
## Attribute Macros[§](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/#attributes)

[test](https://docs.rs/futures-test/latest/futures_test/attr.test.html "attr futures_test::test")
    Enables an `async` test function. The generated future will be run to completion with [`futures_executor::block_on`](https://docs.rs/futures-executor/0.3.31/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/futures_executor/local_pool/fn.block_on.html "fn futures_executor::local_pool::block_on").

enriched_crate.readme_summary: The `futures-test` crate provides utilities for testing asynchronous Rust code, including futures, streams, sinks, and async I/O. It offers combinators for mocking and asserting behavior, along with macros like `assert_stream_done`, `assert_stream_next`, and `assert_stream_pending` to validate stream polling outcomes. Additionally, it includes an attribute macro for writing `async` test functions that run to completion using `futures_executor::block_on`.
enriched_crate.factual_counterfactual:
### Pair 1: Testing Futures  
✅ Factual: The `futures-test` crate provides utilities such as the `assert_stream_done` macro to verify that a stream has completed by returning `Poll::Ready` with no further items.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `futures-test` crate includes a macro to automatically generate mock implementations of `Future` traits for arbitrary types.  

---

### Pair 2: Async IO Testing  
✅ Factual: The `futures-test::io` module offers combinators specifically designed for testing asynchronous IO operations, such as simulating reading and writing behavior.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `futures-test::io` module includes built-in support for benchmarking the performance of async IO operations in production environments.  

---

### Pair 3: Task Utilities  
✅ Factual: The `futures-test::task` module provides utilities for simulating task execution, including creating mock `Waker` instances for testing.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `futures-test::task` module automatically integrates with the Tokio runtime to test tasks in a real-world execution environment.
